content: So, what's the story behind the t-prefix on most of the channels?
t- is for teams, wg- is for working groups
Thanks! So, what's the difference between a team and a working group? :)
Ah, I see, working groups are inside teams
working groups can also be standalone (like wg-embedded, wg-cli...)
the difference is that working groups (usually) don't have any membership requirements and are focused on a specific issue
while teams have actual decision power over a part of the rust project and usually more strict membership requirements
Yes, I remember seeing announcements that so-and-so is now a member on this-or-that team
I have to go now, thank you for taking the time to answer my questions
